GIS.geometry

Class GISPoint

  • java.lang.Object
    • GIS.geometry.Geometry
      • GIS.geometry.GISPoint

  • public class GISPoint
extends Geometry
    Creates an empty Point Object. (GISPoint because Point class already exists in Java.awt) Coordinates can be added with the Method "createPoint()", that will add values to x and y. To write Feature in DB or CSV the coordinates can be transformed to the right format using "writeAsText()". To read it from a DB or CSV use "textToPoint()"

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      double x
      The X coordinate of a point object, default 0
      double y
      The Y coordinate of a point object, default 0

      • Fields inherited from class GIS.geometry.Geometry

        id, type

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GISPoint()
      Constructor calls the constructor of the super class (Geometry) and sets the type

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean createPoint(double x, double y)
      assign x and y values derived from the plotting area to the objects attributes: this.x = x this.y = y return true when processed sucessfull
      boolean geometryAsTextToPoint(java.lang.String geometry)
      when receiving a point from a DB/CSV it will be stored in the string: "1.234 5.678" geometryAsTextToPoint("1.234 5.678") will split the string at the " " and return an Array with x and y values, which then can be assigned to this.x and this.y.
      double getX()
      returns X coordinate (the attribute x) (if the attribute is not filled yet, tell the user to use createPoint)
      double getY()
      returns Y coordinate (the attribute y) (if the attribute is not filled yet, tell the user to use createPoint)
      java.lang.String writeGeometryAsText()
      write the point so that they can be stored as a string in a DB/CSV and be reconstructed to a Point when loaded.

      • Methods inherited from class GIS.geometry.Geometry

        getID, getType

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

        The X coordinate of a point object, default 0

      • y

        The Y coordinate of a point object, default 0

    • Constructor Detail

      • GISPoint

        public GISPoint()
        Constructor calls the constructor of the super class (Geometry) and sets the type

    • Method Detail

      • createPoint

        public boolean createPoint(double x,
                           double y)
        assign x and y values derived from the plotting area to the objects attributes: this.x = x this.y = y return true when processed sucessfull
        Parameters:
        x - X coordinate
        y - Y coordinate
        Returns:
        true when successful, false when faulty

      • writeGeometryAsText

        public java.lang.String writeGeometryAsText()
        write the point so that they can be stored as a string in a DB/CSV and be reconstructed to a Point when loaded. should be something like that: this.x = 1.234 this.y = 5.678 writeAsText() "1.234 5.678"
        Returns:
        String with the Geometry as readable Text

      • geometryAsTextToPoint

        public boolean geometryAsTextToPoint(java.lang.String geometry)
        when receiving a point from a DB/CSV it will be stored in the string: "1.234 5.678" geometryAsTextToPoint("1.234 5.678") will split the string at the " " and return an Array with x and y values, which then can be assigned to this.x and this.y. return true when processed successful
        Parameters:
        geometry - a String received from writeGeometryAsText()
        Returns:
        true when method was sucessfull, false for errors

      • getX

        public double getX()
        returns X coordinate (the attribute x) (if the attribute is not filled yet, tell the user to use createPoint)
        Returns:
        X coordinate

      • getY

        public double getY()
        returns Y coordinate (the attribute y) (if the attribute is not filled yet, tell the user to use createPoint)
        Returns:
        Y coordinate
